comment._content: It's always so much fun here! I'm not Irish (we're from England originally), but I always enjoy the witty comments, the cool photos and the great detective work that goes on. The few minutes I spend here on Flickr are very much enjoyed!

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: Congratulations to everyone. Just in case you get lost, here is the historic OSI map. maps.osi.ie/publicviewer/#V1,716232,733737,7,9

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/blackpoolbeach] And the red cross on this one is where all the magic happens, at no. 4 Kildare Street! The Kildare Street Club next door is now our Manuscript Department, so by and large a lot less drinking and billiard playing goes on there these days. Never knew that no. 5 was a Ry (Railway?) Clearing House. Or that we had a Turkish Baths around the back of us on Leinster Lane!
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 31536722@N00
comment._content:
Comhghairdeachas libh. Congratulations on the award. It's great to see all these wonderful photographs being made available to a world-wide audience through modern technology. 

Now, if something could be done to shake the dust off the operation of the Reading Room in the Library... That would take money, of course, and it's never been properly funded. Just like the National Archive.

Looking forward to seeing more gems from you on flickr.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/an_solas] Thanks again!  :)
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 69587809@N05
comment._content: Hearty congratulations to Carol and the National Library of Ireland.  You really deserve the award for your engagement with the public.  An institution not very far from Ireland has a large Flickr Photo-stream - at present from the First World War - but it gets very few comments and answers none. What a pity it doesn't take a leaf out of your book.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/mosskayree] You're very kind, thank you! Couldn't do any of this without you...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 56225952@N06
comment._content: Carry on the good work and thank you too to all those who commented on and annotated the photographs. I've learned more about REAL Irish history in the past year than in all my lifetime. Mind you at school they didn't bother to tell us anything about Ireland and her history preferring to bore us brainless with dates etc. and it was by reading Joyce that I became interested and decided to go deeper into it.  This is history as it should be taught.  Fantastic!!
